function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"High density of pupils and small children in kindergartens can contribute to the spread of infections.","Impact":"Increased risk of infection in densely populated areas with high numbers of children.","Mitigation":"Implementing social distancing measures, frequent testing, and strict hygiene protocols in educational institutions.","Technologies":"Testing and surveillance technologies for early detection of infections.","People":"Pupils, small children, educators, and staff in educational institutions.","Owner":"Government health authorities, educational institutions, and local public health agencies."},{"Description":"Absence of regular testing for children in the national testing strategy can lead to undetected cases in schools and day care centers.","Impact":"Limited ability to track and control the spread of infections among children in educational settings.","Mitigation":"Implementing regular testing protocols for children, especially in high-density areas such as schools and day care centers.","Technologies":"Rapid testing kits and surveillance technologies for frequent monitoring of children in educational institutions.","People":"Children, educators, staff, and parents in educational institutions.","Owner":"Government health authorities, educational institutions, and local public health agencies."},{"Description":"Lack of systematically collected data on tests performed by age group and region can limit the understanding of infection patterns among children.","Impact":"Difficulty in analyzing and identifying infection trends among different age groups and regions.","Mitigation":"Establishing comprehensive data collection protocols for tests performed by age group and region, and integrating this data into national surveillance systems.","Technologies":"Data management systems for integrated surveillance and analysis of test results by age and region.","People":"Epidemiologists, public health researchers, and government health agencies.","Owner":"Health research institutions and government health agencies."}]}
